titlestmt.titleproper: Bryn Mawr College oral histories collection 1963-2002
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Bryn Mawr College oral histories collection

bioghist.p: The Bryn Mawr Alumnae Association held their first meeting in 1890, and was chartered and incorporated in 1897 "to further the interests and the general welfare" of the College and "to cultivate intimate relations and friendly feelings" among its alumnae.

scopecontent.p: A collection of oral histories collected by the Bryn Mawr Alumnae Association beginning in 1979. Included are group interviews with various alumnae classes, interviews with students and staff, and interviews with individual faculty and alumnae, such as Constance Applebee, Frederica de Laguna, Lucy Shoe Meritt, Marianne Moore, Milton Nahm, and Hilda Smith.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
